did.unittitle: Stanley C. Marshall papers 1944-2005 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Stanley C. Marshall was a pioneer in the field of strategic market planning, and an educator, lecturer, and humanitarian. The Stanley C. Marshall Papers span the years 1944-2005 and include client files, speeches and presentations, publications, correspondence, advertising and civic awards, photographs, slides, audiocassettes and audiotapes, videocassettes and videotapes, motion picture film reels, and digital audio tape that document Marshall's career as a strategic marketing planner and consultant, as well as his involvement with humanitarian projects. The collection reflects Marshall's work for advertising and marketing firms, including Lando, Marsteller Advertising, and his own company, Stanley Marshall, Inc. Client files include 3M, Black Box, Delta Dental Plan, General Electric, International Management Center, PPG, Pure Industries (Stackpole), Scott Fetzer (Berkshire Hathaway), Sony, United Jewish Foundation, and Westinghouse. Also documented are Marshall's activities with public service and educational organizations that include UNICEF, the Conflict Resolution Center, the Negro Educational Emergency Drive (NEED, a project of the Urban League of Pittsburgh), the Network of International Business Schools (NIBS), and the Penn Technical Institute (a junior college, now part of the Pittsburgh Technical Institute). A significant portion of the files relate to businesses and institutions in the Pittsburgh, Pa., area.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Use copies are available in the collection.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Stanley C. Marshall Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Stanley C. Marshall Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Greg Johnson, July 01, 2006. Additional processing by Richard Collier, August 2007
Encoded by Greg Johnson and Richard Collier
Accession 2005-0095 is described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note

eventgrp.event: Sales Promotions Manager and Editor of Technical Publications, Sauerman Brothers, Chicago, Ill.
Account Executive, Promotions, Inc., Chicago, Ill.

chronitem.event: Graduate program, Television and Industrial Engineering, Illinois Institute of Technology
Assistant to the Director, Penn Technical Institute

eventgrp.event: Director and President, Pittsburgh Commerce Institute

chronitem.event: Vice President and General Manager of Marstellar Inc.'s Pittsburgh office
Elected to the Pittsburgh Advertising Federation Hall of Fame

bioghist.p: During his career, Marshall held the rank of Adjunct Professor at the Katz School of Business at the University of Pittsburgh. Marshall also lectured at Boston University, Carnegie-Mellon University, Duquesne University, in the United Kingdom, Poland, and Hungary, as well as the US Department of Commerce, UNICEF, and the American Management Association.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Stanley C. Marshall Papers span the years 1944-2005 and include client files, speeches and presentations, publications, correspondence, advertising and civic awards, photographs, slides, audiocassettes and audiotapes, videocassettes and videotapes, motion picture film reels, and digital audio tape that document Marshall's career as a strategic marketing planner and consultant, as well as his involvement with humanitarian projects. The collection reflects Marshall's work for advertising and marketing firms, including Lando, Marsteller Advertising, and his own company, Stanley Marshall, Inc. Clients include 3M, Black Box, Delta Dental Plan, General Electric, International Management Center, PPG, Pure Industries (Stackpole), Scott Fetzer (Berkshire Hathaway), Sony, United Jewish Foundation, and Westinghouse. Also documented are Marshall's activities with public service and educational organizations that include UNICEF, the Conflict Resolution Center, the Negro Educational Emergency Drive (NEED, a project of the Urban League of Pittsburgh), the Network of International Business Schools (NIBS), and the Penn Technical Institute (a junior college, now part of the Pittsburgh Technical Institute). A significant portion of the files relate to businesses and institutions in the Pittsburgh, Pa., area.

The collection is organized into four series: Personal Files, Client Files,
Professional Files, and Audiovisual Materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional information on advertising and marketing in the Pittsburgh, Pa., region may be found in the John E. Brennan Outdoor Advertising Surveys and the Outdoor Advertising Association of America Slide Library. Additional information on companies and institutions documented in this collection may be found in the Brouillard Communications, Inc., Records (General Electric, 3M), the D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles Archives (UNICEF), the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) Account Files (PPG Industries), the JWT John Devine Papers (PPG Industries), the JWT Edgar Hatcher Papers (General Electric), the JWT Advertising Vertical Files (Marsteller), and the JWT Corporation Vertical Files (General Electric).

scopecontent.p: Consists of strategic plans created for clients of Marshall, as well as correspondence and notes. Arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Construction Industry Advancement Program (CIAP) of Western Pennsylvania, 1970
Indiana Society of Communication Strategists, 1987 and undated
Pittsburgh International Initiative of Western Pennsylvania, 1991
Scott Fetzer Company (subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway)

scopecontent.p:
Includes correspondence and literature, awards and honors, and other ephemera from Marshall's personal philanthropic work. Series is organized into 3 subseries: Civic Work,
Honors and Memorabilia, and Photographs.
Includes letters, fliers, and promotional materials that document Marshall's work with public service and educational institutions.

did.unittitle: African American Chamber of Commerce, 2002 and undated
Negro Emergency Educational Drive (N.E.E.D), 1992-2001 and undated

scopecontent.p: [Project initiated in 1963 by the Urban League of Pittsburgh, to raise tuition money for college-bound low-income African Americans living in the Pittsburgh-Western Pennsylvania region.]
[Organization founded in 1970 to promote and teach small business management skills in the developing world, beginning in Kenya.]

did.unittitle: University of Pittsburgh Corporate Marketing Advisory Council, 1993-1994
Honors and Memorabilia Subseries, 1966-1991 and undated

scopecontent.p: Includes awards, plaques, and other memorabilia received by Marshall during his career.

[Includes certificates from the Allegheny County chapter of the American Marketing Association; Association of National Advertisers; Business and Professional Advertising Association (BPAA); Delta Dental Plan; Mt. Lebanon Magazine; PfP; and the Public Relations Association of America.]

did.unittitle: Advertising Agency Executive of the Year, BPAA Pittsburgh, 1977
Anniversary plaque from Joan and Al Dudreck, 1989
Medal on ribbon, inscribed Mendelssohn für Kunst/Ehrens zeichen #7, 1999
Pittsburgh Junior Chamber of Commerce, award, 1954
Stanley Marshall, Inc., embossing stamp, undated
World Federalist Association of Pittsburgh, Norman Cousins Award, 2000

scopecontent.p:
Consists of invoices, legal documents, correspondence, writings, and sample forms and letters used by Marshall during his career with Lando, Inc., Marstellar, and Stanley C. Marshall, Inc.. Series is organized into 3 subseries: Office Files,
Speeches and Presentations, and Writings.

did.unittitle: Speeches and Presentations Subseries, 1965-2003 and undated

scopecontent.p: Includes speeches and presentations given by Marshall during his career. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Manuals and other writings for General Electric, 1944 and undated
Marketing In A Shell Shocked Economy, 2001
Marketing: the key to competitiveness, undated

scopecontent.p: Consists of audio and visual copies of radio spots, interviews, and presentations by Marshall during his career.

Digital audio files are available for some of the materials in this series (OR13, OR14, OR16, OR20, OR22, OR26, OR41, OR42, OR43). They are located at: S:\Processed\Marshall, Stanley\audio files. Consult Reference staff for assistance.

accessrestrict.p: Original and Production copies are closed to patron use.

scopecontent.p: Format: Audio cassette and Compact Disc. Created: 2006-2007.
Oversize materials include a hand drawn caricature of Stanley Marshall and various printed bulletins and flyers.
